Big, clean, extremely cold aircon (bring a thin jacket). Service minded, pleasant employees. A lot of different shops and products to choose from. What REALLY brings this experience down, is the fact that all these SM malls insist on playing the "super jolly, happy-happy "SM super mall" song" every few minutes... At FULL BLAST! This is extremely annoying after hearing it for the N'th time! It becomes pure noise pollution... Please, at least reduce the volume at which the song is played? Update: Today, the amount of noise from "music" was pleasantly reduced

A typical mall wherein you can dine, shop, go window shopping, watch cinema, etc. Comes with a free parking space for car users. Has restrooms for your poo and wee needs. Wheelchair friendly as it was accessible for wheelchair users. Still follows the COVID protocols set by the government

THE the overall facility is nice however the parking is very minimal you could only find a decent parking spot on the second floor and the first floors they are always full at any given moment does some of the guards are a bit arrogant but not all of them somewhere even nice and very nice and would even apologize for every little inconvenience the mall has a lot of variety you can find it with any food there but the supermarket is not that very you can find all of the products that you are looking for and sometimes there are not properly stuff sometimes you have to wait weeks to have that particular product their advantage card is a nice touch though

This Mall is consistent with all the others, very clean and well kept. Security is well assured, it is easy to find a parking space. I know many SMs all over the Philippines but this one has a particularly infuriating feature. Indeed, apart from the Department Store where the staff is always courteous and knows how to behave, in almost all the stands the employees have their eyes riveted on their mobile phones and visibly speaking to them bothers them to the highest point, they barely look to be interested in your request it's stressful, embarrassing and particularly rude. Usually I give 5 stars but for this SM it will be 3 stars üòí

Don't even try to book on this hotel. The wedding that I attended finished 9pm. I am in need of a hotel since I don't want to drive late at night because I have poor vision. I browsed Google maps and found ninong's hotel, and I immediately booked online since the hotel name seems very familiar. When me and my girlfriend arrived the employees seems very nice and accommodating. I had no problem with the employees. But when we were going to the rooms the aisles smelled like animal pee, I just shoved it off and thought that maybe inside the room the pee smell wouldn't reach, but alas. The smell inside the room smells like animal pee and flood water as well and the room is very humid. I touched the blanket and it feels almost wet from the room humidity. We decided to transfer to another room but they said they have no available rooms other than the rooms on that floor (ground floor) which probably also smells like dog pee. We tried to get a refund but they said since we booked online we should request the refund online. We were so tired that day so We agreed and thought that we will just try to get the refund when we get inside another hotel. But when we try to refund online there is no refund or cancellation button. We tried to reach out their Facebook page and they said payment upon reservation is non refundable. 5 days before the reservation is allowed for refund and cancellation. So we can't refund because our booking is not in advance? The owner is greedy, what a shame. For those who say I'm just lying just try going and booking there and see and "smell" for yourself.

Good Air-conditioning (best cold spot is at the yogurt place on the 2nd flr), lack of free seating though, unless the foodcourt counts. But it's a good place for family, pets and friends. Bookstores, restaurants, and other shops seem well stocked enough to suit the needs for the location. Plenty of restrooms, but avoid not planning ahead when visiting on the 15th and 30th of the month (paydays) because of the surge in volume of visitors.
